result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Noah C Mason was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:

Engage in, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment ordered by the agent.  

Take part in a mandatory sex offender assessment.  Participate in any treatment at the discretion of the agent.

No contact with the victim unless permitted by the agent.

Defendant to be afforded Youthful Offender Treatment for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation as well as the felony diversion agreement that the Defendant also has for Count 1.  Defendant to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah C Mason

records.addlTxt: to Dismiss DPA (forwarded to the Court for signature 4/9/19; sk)
for Dismissal of Criminal Diversion Agreement

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DOC Certificate of Discharge and Satisfaction of Probation Conditions for Expungement (clerk notes that Def is still on deferred prosecution per agreement with DA; case expungement won't occur until after deferred agreement terms have been fully satisfied and DA has notified the Court of such)

Defendant Noah C Mason in court with attorney Roger G Merry. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution.  DA Harper has filed an amended information that includes Count 1 as originally charged and then three additional counts of 4th degree sexual assault.  Per DA, the agreement of the parties calls for def's plea to all four counts for entry of a DPA on Count 1 and probation on Counts 2-4 with conditions to include s.o. treatment, no contact with named victim in the complaint except as allowed by agent, expungement upon succ. complet. of DPA, and 7 days conditional jail time on count 2.

Defense does not object to the filing of the amended information which contains the three additional charges.

Def pleads no contest to all four counts.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Judgment withheld on Count 1 for DPA entry.  

DA addresses the Court.  Atty. Merry addresses the Court.

Sentence/judgment on Counts 2, 3, and 4:  withheld for probation of 2 years.  Conditions:  engage in, pay for, and succ. complete any treatment as ordered by agent; mandatory s.o. asst; treatment at discretion of agent; no contact with victim unless permitted by agent.

Sentence withheld for DPA on Count 1 - 4 years.

Defendant to be afforded Youthful Offender's Treatment for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of both probation and the DPA.  Def to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.

Def to sign up for probation by the end of the day tomorrow.

Defendant Noah C Mason in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Roger G Merry appeared by phone means for Defendant Noah C Mason.  Further status requested and set.  3/4 at 3:30.  Status conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Letter from Merry Law Office requesting telephone appearance - Granted
Status conference on January 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

DA Harper for State. Def in person and with Atty Roger Merry.  DA gives status, information presented. Waiver of prelim. Colloquy, accepts waiver and binds def over for trial. Court informs def of charges on information. NG plea entered. Status 01/14/15 @ 3:30 p.m. State requests $1000 signature bond.
